title: Could not sign validator registration

labels.name: Builder
labels.description: PR or issue that supports builder related work

body:
# üêû Bug Report
- EL Geth version: `v1.10.23`
- BN/VC Prysm version: `v3.1.1`
- MEV-Boost version: `v1.3.2`
- Web3Signer version: `22.8.1-jdk17`

### Description

When running Geth/Prysm/MEV-Boost (and Web3Signer) combo on `mainnet`, with only one key, I get this error on Prysm VC:
```
time="2022-09-28 10:02:27" level=error msg="could not sign validator registration: http: ContentLength=362 with Body length 0" feeRecipient=0x388C818CA8B9251b393131C08a736A67ccB19297 prefix=validator pubkey=0x83ac9977c01b00c54b54f66f562dc40c052f344cf8d2dd3254c52f350a320340a237eb9fa2be2cd71b127c13eb5ee8b8
```

However, I get this in BN logs, which seems normal.
```
time="2022-09-28 07:48:44" level=info msg="Waiting for state to be initialized" prefix=initial-sync
time="2022-09-28 07:48:44" level=info msg="Builder has been configured" endpoint="http://mainnet-mev-boost-debug:18550"
time="2022-09-28 07:48:44" level=warning msg="Outsourcing block construction to external builders adds non-trivial delay to block propagation time.  Builder-constructed blocks or fallback blocks may get orphaned. Use at your own risk!"
```

MEV-Boost logs:
```
time="2022-09-28T09:59:07Z" level=info msg="mev-boost v1.3.2" module=cli
time="2022-09-28T09:59:07Z" level=info msg="using genesis fork version: 0x00000000" module=cli
time="2022-09-28T09:59:07Z" level=info msg="using 1 relays" module=cli relays="[https://0xac6e77dfe25ecd6110b8e780608cce0dab71fdd5ebea22a16c0205200f2f8e2e3ad3b71d3499c54ad14d6c21b41a37ae@boost-relay.flashbots.net]"
time="2022-09-28T09:59:07Z" level=info msg="listening on 0.0.0.0:18550" module=cli
time="2022-09-28T12:04:40Z" level=info msg="http: GET /eth/v1/builder/status 200" duration=0.184968 method=GET module=service path=/eth/v1/builder/status status=200
```

In a normal situation, VC logs should looks like this:
```
time="2022-09-28 07:50:48" level=info msg="Submitted builder validator registration settings for custom builders" prefix=validator
```

Specific configurations:

**BN**:
```
http-mev-relay: http://mainnet-mev-boost-debug:18550
< ... And other values not related to block proposal ... >
```

**VC**:
```
suggested-fee-recipient: 0x388C818CA8B9251b393131C08a736A67ccB19297
enable-builder: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
- 0x83ac9977c01b00c54b54f66f562dc40c052f344cf8d2dd3254c52f350a320340a237eb9fa2be2cd71b127c13eb5ee8b8
< ... And other values not related to block proposal ... >
```

**MEV-Boost**:
```
-mainnet
-relay-check
-relays=https://0xac6e77dfe25ecd6110b8e780608cce0dab71fdd5ebea22a16c0205200f2f8e2e3ad3b71d3499c54ad14d6c21b41a37ae@boost-relay.flashbots.net
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Operating System:**
I use Docker images over Kubernetes on EKS/AWS.

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**
I successfully run with the same configuration (to the best of my knowledge) the same combo on Sepolia and Goerli.
Do you see anything on web3signer? maybe something wasn't properly added in web3signer?

Do you think this issue is related to W3S?
Apart proposing block via MEV-boost, everything goes well:
- Attestations are OK
- Block proposals are OK (but coming from EL)

To be 100% sure this issue does not come from W3S, I will create a `debug` W3S instance especially with only the key I'm trying to get working with Prysm.

you mentioned you're using > and Web3Signer

since the validator registration needs to be signed it submits it to the Web3signer to sign before submitting the registration requestion to the MEV relay.

OK:

Here is log from Prysm VC:
```
time="2022-09-28 14:13:42" level=error msg="could not sign validator registration: http: ContentLength=362 with Body length 0" feeRecipient=0x388C818CA8B9251b393131C08a736A67ccB19297 prefix=validator pubkey=0x83ac9977c01b00c54b54f66f562dc40c052f344cf8d2dd3254c52f350a320340a237eb9fa2be2cd71b127c13eb5ee8b8
```

And, at the same timestamp, log from Web3Signer:
```
2022-09-28 14:13:42.483+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-0 | ERROR | LogErrorHandler | Failed request: http://mainnet-web3signer-debug.ethereum-web3signer:9000/api/v1/eth2/sign/0x83ac9977c01b00c54b54f66f562dc40c052f344cf8d2dd3254c52f350a320340a237eb9fa2be2cd71b127c13eb5ee8b8

	at tech.pegasys.web3signer.core.service.http.handlers.signing.eth2.Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.handle(Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.java:58) ~[web3signer-core-22.8.1.jar:22.8.1]

	at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextImpl.lambda$null$0(ContextImpl.java:159) ~[vertx-core-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]
	at io.vertx.core.impl.AbstractContext.dispatch(AbstractContext.java:101) ~[vertx-core-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]
	at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextImpl.lambda$executeBlocking$1(ContextImpl.java:157) ~[vertx-core-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source) ~[?:?]
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source) ~[?:?]

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) ~[?:?]
2022-09-28 14:13:42.488+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-0 | ERROR | RoutingContext | Unhandled exception in router
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Signing root 0x5c9620a66902da4a7fb804384c48ec41addacc1884862020058d4bb1300e7e53 must match signing computed signing root 0x93b10c0ddc8a81dc89d3f30e7ccc85c7e5a20eb75d67bbb2a0ddb486b8f7c51d from data
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:435) ~[guava-31.0.1-jre.jar:?]
	at tech.pegasys.web3signer.core.service.http.handlers.signing.eth2.Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.handle(Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.java:105) ~[web3signer-core-22.8.1.jar:22.8.1]
	at tech.pegasys.web3signer.core.service.http.handlers.signing.eth2.Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.handle(Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.java:58) ~[web3signer-core-22.8.1.jar:22.8.1]
	at io.vertx.ext.web.impl.BlockingHandlerDecorator.lambda$handle$0(BlockingHandlerDecorator.java:48) ~[vertx-web-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]
	at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextImpl.lambda$null$0(ContextImpl.java:159) ~[vertx-core-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]
	at io.vertx.core.impl.AbstractContext.dispatch(AbstractContext.java:101) ~[vertx-core-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]
	at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextImpl.lambda$executeBlocking$1(ContextImpl.java:157) ~[vertx-core-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]

2022-09-28 14:14:47.972+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-0 | ERROR | LogErrorHandler | Failed request: http://mainnet-web3signer-debug.ethereum-web3signer:9000/api/v1/eth2/sign/0x83ac9977c01b00c54b54f66f562dc40c052f344cf8d2dd3254c52f350a320340a237eb9fa2be2cd71b127c13eb5ee8b8
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Signing root 0x2f8fbcfa01c214871ceca35feac3c00a90eb963c0a774b3b1059c89f1a488c72 must match signing computed signing root 0x372c32774a163e544671ba1b327e87354c92d8b9b62628071f31911c57985971 from data
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:435) ~[guava-31.0.1-jre.jar:?]
	at tech.pegasys.web3signer.core.service.http.handlers.signing.eth2.Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.handle(Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.java:105) ~[web3signer-core-22.8.1.jar:22.8.1]
	at tech.pegasys.web3signer.core.service.http.handlers.signing.eth2.Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.handle(Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.java:58) ~[web3signer-core-22.8.1.jar:22.8.1]
	at io.vertx.ext.web.impl.BlockingHandlerDecorator.lambda$handle$0(BlockingHandlerDecorator.java:48) ~[vertx-web-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) ~[?:?]
2022-09-28 14:14:47.973+00:00 | vert.x-eventloop-thread-0 | ERROR | RoutingContext | Unhandled exception in router
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Signing root 0x2f8fbcfa01c214871ceca35feac3c00a90eb963c0a774b3b1059c89f1a488c72 must match signing computed signing root 0x372c32774a163e544671ba1b327e87354c92d8b9b62628071f31911c57985971 from data
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:435) ~[guava-31.0.1-jre.jar:?]
	at tech.pegasys.web3signer.core.service.http.handlers.signing.eth2.Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.handle(Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.java:105) ~[web3signer-core-22.8.1.jar:22.8.1]
	at tech.pegasys.web3signer.core.service.http.handlers.signing.eth2.Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.handle(Eth2SignForIdentifierHandler.java:58) ~[web3signer-core-22.8.1.jar:22.8.1]
	at io.vertx.ext.web.impl.BlockingHandlerDecorator.lambda$handle$0(BlockingHandlerDecorator.java:48) ~[vertx-web-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]
	at io.vertx.core.impl.ContextImpl.lambda$null$0(ContextImpl.java:159) ~[vertx-core-4.3.1.jar:4.3.1]

```

Do you think the issue could come:
- From Prysm?
- From Web3Signer?
- From a bad configuration on my side?

I'm guessing it's a configuration issue, most likely with web3signer (possibly due to the network it's on?) it looks like it's on mainnet? web3signer does a validator of the schema of the request so guessing it's not the format of the data sent... if it's using the latest we can see if anything changed recently.

You'r right!

Found this in the Web3Signer configuration:
```
eth2.network: prater
```

instead of

```
eth2.network: mainnet
```

Thanks a lot for your support!
